Description: Rough brown ware bowl made of dense Nile silt pottery mixed with organics and grasses. Rim pinched to taper, irregular with two peaks on opposing sides. Exterior is brown and soot stained, smoothed by brushing. Interior was scraped to smooth with some soot staining and wear. Base is rounded.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s (1937) Rough Brown RB19Q. This vessel was the only object in the grave of a child and was found before the face.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (p. 39; pl. 20.19Q)
